description: Detailed map of southern United States from Cincinnati, Ohio, to northern Florida. Shows drainage, the Ohio River railroad system, cities and towns, county boundaries.

notes: Includes concentric circles at 50-mile intervals from Knoxville. Indicates coal fields of Kentucky and Tennessee.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
repository: Library of Congress Geography and Map Division Washington, D.C. 20540-4650 USA dcu

description: Scale ca. 1:500,000. Cover title. Alternate title from Peter Force's catalog of printed maps: Florida and its vicinity. Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings. "To the Marine Society of the city of New York ...; To the hon'ble, the planters in Jamaica ...; To all commanders of vessels round the globe ... " Drawn in 1774, but was not published until 1781, 6 years after the author's A concise natural history of East and West Florida, to which it belongs. Includes sailing directions, notes on some shipwrecks, 9 land identification profiles, "View of the entrance of St. Mary's River," and "View of Fort St. Marks, at Apalache seen from th[e so]uthward ... " LC Maps of North America, 1750-1789, 1622 Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Vault AACR2

medium: 2 maps on 3 sheets 237 x 80 cm. or smaller fold. in cover 64 & 48 cm.
notes: Alternate title from Peter Force's catalog of printed maps: Florida and its vicinity.
Relief shown by hachures. Depths shown by soundings.
"To the Marine Society of the city of New York ...; To the hon'ble, the planters in Jamaica ...; To all commanders of vessels round the globe ... "
Drawn in 1774, but was not published until 1781, 6 years after the author's A concise natural history of East and West Florida, to which it belongs.

Includes sailing directions, notes on some shipwrecks, 9 land identification profiles, "View of the entrance of St. Mary's River," and "View of Fort St. Marks, at Apalache seen from th[e so]uthward ... "
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
repository: Library of Congress Geography and Map Division Washington, D.C. 20540-4650 USA dcu

description: This record covers single maps of Hawaii as a whole covering various subjects, which are not represented in the LC database by separate catalog records. This collection includes single printed maps and photocopies of printed or manuscript single maps and may also include some multi-sheet single maps, plates from atlases, books or periodicals, and printed facsimiles. These maps show various subjects, such as topography and other physical characteristics, public lands and land use, mines and minerals, geology, hydrology, administrative and political divisions, and recreation and tourism. To request a specific map or for more information, contact a reference librarian in the Geography & Map Division (202) 707-6277 or through the "Ask a librarian" link through the Geography & Map Division website https://www.loc.gov/rr/geogmap/. Title supplied by cataloger. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Drawers 4-8, 10.

medium: 6 drawers of maps : some color, some photocopies ; various sizes.
notes: This record covers single maps of Hawaii as a whole covering various subjects, which are not represented in the LC database by separate catalog records. This collection includes single printed maps and photocopies of printed or manuscript single maps and may also include some multi-sheet single maps, plates from atlases, books or periodicals, and printed facsimiles. These maps show various subjects, such as topography and other physical characteristics, public lands and land use, mines and minerals, geology, hydrology, administrative and political divisions, and recreation and tourism. To request a specific map or for more information, contact a reference librarian in the Geography & Map Division (202) 707-6277 or through the "Ask a librarian" link through the Geography & Map Division website https://www.loc.gov/rr/geogmap/.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.

description: Shows region between Nancy and Dijon. Relief shown by contours, shading, and spot heights. Title of upper right base sheet: Carte de France et des frontières à 1/200.000 (type 1912). Black ink and blue pencil on 4 mutilated printed maps pasted together. Stamped on: Summerall papers. On upper left base sheet: No. 26 Troyes. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Includes index to sheets and boundary diagram. Vault ARP
